array.name: car
array.item: "Use carpooling (if you take i-95 on your way to the museum, you can drive in the diamond lane)" " or public transit to help save hundreds of tons of carbon emmsions from entering our atmosphere " "yearly.\n\nDrive at the speed limit! All vehicles lose fuel economy at speeds above 55 miles per hour. " "And driving 65 instead of 75 reduces fuel cost 13%"

array.name: machine
array.item: "Make sure you only wash your clothes when the machine is fully loaded"

array.name: line
array.item: "Save energy by hanging your clothes to dry instead of using a dryer." "Simply letting your clothes dry for a few hours before tossing them in" " the dryer makes the dryer more efficient and waste less energy."

array.name: bins

array.name: power
array.item: "Use a power strip and turn it off when electronics are not in use!"

array.name: window
array.item: "Replace old curtains with honeycomb shades. They have folds of fabric" " that create multiple air pockets and help insulate windows."

array.name: door
array.item: "Keep doors open to allow cool air to move freely through your home"

array.name: light
array.item: "Using the ENERGY STAR Certified Light Bulbs (the twisty ones) takes 70-90% less energy than" " traditional incandescent bulbs. They last 10 to 25 times longer and save $30 to $80 in electricity" " costs over their lifetime."

array.name: temp
array.item: "In the winter, put on more layers instead of turning up the heat!" " And in the summer, open windows instead up turning on the AC."

array.name: shower
array.item: "Taking a shower requires 10 to 25 gallons of water, while taking a bath requires about 70 gallons"

array.name: sink
array.item: "By turning of the faucet while brushing teeth, you can save approx. 100 gallons each month"

array.name: sink2
array.item: "The average person uses approx. 100 gallons of water each day, " "this can be cut by 30% by simple steps like repairing dripping faucets"

array.name: dishwasher
array.item: " Operate your dishwasher only when it’s fully loaded, otherwise, use the sink"

array.name: oven

array.name: check
array.item: "Installing solar panels will not only cut your electricity bill costs, but also " "can lower your taxes!"

array.name: can
array.item: "DO recycle aluminum cans, glass bottles (any color!), plastic containers numbered 1-7 , and steel cans and remember to clean your containers of food residue before recycling!\nDON\'T recycle plastic bags, food wrappers, or Styrofoam. While you can’t recycle plastic bags with your other recyclables, you can return them to most grocery stores or, just use reusable bags when shopping."

array.name: cardboard
array.item: "When recycling cardboard be sure to flatten the boxes and remove extra tape."

array.name: paper
array.item: "DO recycle glossy, white, colored papers, magazines, junk mail, and file folders.\nDON\'T recycle plastic coated papers, food/wrappers. And did you know you don’t need to remove the staples or tape on a paper before recycling?"

array.name: phone
array.item: "Did you know you can recycle your old electronics? \n" "Rechargeable Batteries, audio and video tapes, computer equipment, monitors," "CDs, cell phones, and toner cartridges can all be sent to a local recycling facility.\n" "About 85% of electronics are discarded in landfills or incinerators, and about 5" "million devices gather dust in storage. When these aren’t recycled, hazardous waste can seep into " "groundwater and cause serious pollution and health risks"

array.name: socks
array.item: "Grew out of your old clothes? Deliver them to a local charity or thrift store."

array.name: cans
array.item: "Aluminum cans can take anywhere between 200 to 500 years to decompose in a landfill. Did you know that making new aluminum cans from recycled cans takes 95% less energy than creating the same amount with aluminum oxides "

array.name: paper_bag
array.item: "Paper bags only take 1 month to decompose! Consider taking your lunch in a paper bag made with recyled paper instead of a plastic bag!"

array.name: plastic_bottle
array.item: "Plastic bottles take 450 years to decompose! Make sure to throw them in your recyling bin or send them back to the manufacturer for a 5¢ reward! "

array.name: plastic_wrap
array.item: "Aluminum foil takes 400 years to decay! The average american throws out about three pounds of aluminum foil each year where it releases toxic metals and gas into the atmosphere. Few people know that clean aluminum foil can easily be recyled along with aluminum cans! "

array.name: banana
array.item: "Banana peels and other fruit peels take only 2 to 5 weeks to decompose!"

array.name: apple
array.item: "An apple core takes up to 2 months to decay."

array.name: glass_bottle
array.item: "If a Neanderthal had dropped a glass bottle in the park in front of MODS it would still be there today! This is because glass bottles take 1 million years to decay!"

array.name: plastic_bag
array.item: "Plastic bags take between 10 and 20 years to decompose. Make sure you bring your own bags to the grocery store or return used bags to the store for reuse!"

array.name: gum
array.item: "Chewing gum is not bidegradable because the base is made of a type of plastic. However, it can be digested by stomach acids in a few hours! "

array.name: decay_explain

array.name: australia
array.item: ""Australia"\n-Signed Kyoto protocol where they agreed to hold the growth in its greenhouse gas emissions to 8 percent above 1990 levels for the 2008-2012 period. By and large, Australia has met those targets, mostly by reducing deforestation and land clearing.\n-Use carbon trading plan, which makes Australia’s top 500 worst polluters pay a tax on every ton of carbon emitted. Currently trying to switch to full on, market-based carbon trading system."
